header.title: Invocation of the Adversary
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Luciferianism, Left Hand Path

central_thesis: The document outlines a dualistic magical ritual designed to invoke the spirit of the Adversary (manifesting as figures like Shaitan, Lucifer, and Set) to facilitate profound self-deification, illumination, and mastery over the self through the gnosis of the Black Flame.

structure_content.summary: This section introduces the ritual's core aim: to invoke the Adversary's spirit to reveal the essence of Iblis, leading to self-deification. It identifies various aspects of the Adversary as Shaitan/Iblis, Satan, Lucifer, Set, and Azazel, framing the practice as a pursuit of the 'fire-spirit of change, rebellion and progression' and equating Set with the 'solar creative (and destructive) force of change and self-deification'.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Two Faces of the Adversary
structure_content.summary: The text details two primary aspects of the Adversary: 'The Fallen Seraph Lucifer,' representing the 'angelick essence of the Black Flame' and the source of wisdom and becoming; and 'The Seraph of Flame,' embodying the Djinn Iblis of Fire, Daemon of the Blackened Flame, and various animalistic forms (serpent, beast, dragon, wolf, goat), acting as an initiator on the path of the wise.

This part instructs the practitioner to wear crimson robes, symbolizing flame and movement. It highlights the use of the averse pentagram, pointing downward to signify the union of fallen angels with humanity for divinity. Within the Sethian Witchcraft Current, the sorcerer is intended to embody Set, becoming 'the first of Witchblood unto the path'.

structure_content.chapter_title: UPON THE HOUR OF NOON - Invocation of the Djinn of Fire
structure_content.summary: This section provides the full text of the Noon ritual. It is an invocation of the Djinn of Fire, calling upon the 'scorching sun,' 'Scorpion soul,' and 'Scorpion Flame' for 'fires of growth and illumination.' The ritual aims for the practitioner to 'become as' the Sun, transcend, ascend, and burn with 'Luciferian Light,' asserting personal power at the 'Crossroads' through specific incantations like 'Zazas, Zazas, Nasatanada Zazas'.

structure_content.chapter_title: UPON THE HOUR OF MIDNIGHT - Invocation
structure_content.summary: This section presents the full text of the Midnight ritual. It is an invocation 'By the Gate of the Black Light,' calling forth Djinn Azazel and Set-heh with a 'Serpent's tongue.' The focus shifts to the 'Shadow,' 'darkness,' and 'Black Sun,' seeking hidden knowledge ('what has been never known'). The practitioner proclaims becoming the 'Peacock Angel beauty,' 'Imagination,' and 'Seed of Fallen Angel,' asserting their will to give birth to 'Incubi and Succubi' in the 'blood of the moon,' through incantations like 'Al Zabbat, Hekas Hekau, Serpent Soul do I summon'.

This concluding section explains the 'dual rite' as a means to command 'the entire approximation of self.' It clarifies that while Noon and Midnight are primary, both points can be used to raise focused energy. The commentary stresses that the ritual is about the practitioner's embodiment of the self within the 'perpetual mastery of the psyche' and the importance of 'gnosis' within the ritual circle. It positions the ritual, especially when combined with the 'Lord's Prayer Averse,' as a 'powerful foundation for self-deification in the Witches Sabbat Gnosis'.

key_concepts.definition: The central numinous entity invoked, representing the 'fire-spirit of change, rebellion and progression,' a 'solar creative (and destructive) force,' and the means to self-deification. It encompasses multiple archetypes from diverse mythologies.
The 'angelick essence of Lucifer' and the core of the Djinn Iblis, symbolizing the intrinsic source of wisdom, being, and becoming within the individual, leading to self-illumination.
The ultimate goal of the ritual, where the practitioner transcends and ascends to become godlike, embodying the attributes of the Adversary, specifically 'as SET him/herself'.
A state of 'enflamed and submerged' deep knowledge and mystical insight, achieved within the ritual circle, where the practitioner loses perception of anything external to their 'sorcerers' world'.
A downward-pointing pentagram, symbolically representing the union of 'fallen angels with humanity to create divinity,' emphasizing an antinomian or transgressive approach to spiritual evolution.
The specific magical tradition or lineage within which this ritual operates, where the sorcerer actively embodies and identifies with the adversarial force of Set.

The solar-aligned aspect of the dual rite, focusing on conscious empowerment, 'scorching sun,' 'Scorpion Flame,' and 'fires of growth and illumination' to achieve outward transcendence and 'Luciferian Light'.

The lunar-aligned aspect of the dual rite, focusing on subconscious integration, 'Black Light,' 'Serpent Soul,' and 'darkened image' to embrace hidden knowledge, imagination, and the 'Shadow' self for inner transformation.

practical_system.description: The system outlines a dualistic magical practice centered on the invocation of the Adversary at specific astronomical hours (Noon and Midnight) to achieve self-deification and mastery. It emphasizes embodying the Adversary (specifically Set in the Sethian current) and experiencing a state of gnosis through the Black Flame within a ritually defined sacred space. The practitioner is positioned as the primary agent of transformation, becoming a vessel or embodiment of the adversarial current.
tools: Ritual circle (implied, as 'circumference of the sorcerers' world')
Mask of two sides (representing the two faces of the Adversary), placed on the altar
rituals: UPON THE HOUR OF NOON - Invocation of the Djinn of Fire
UPON THE HOUR OF MIDNIGHT - Invocation
Lord's Prayer Averse (as an adjunct practice mentioned in the commentary)

relevant_quotes.text: The following is a ritual which may be conducted when the Sun is at its full light, or when the Moon is full or dark, as the essence of Iblis be finally revealed. The purpose of the ritual is invoking the spirit of the Adversary, known as Shaitan/Iblis, Satan, Lucifer, Set, Azazel....

The sorcerer shall seek the fire-spirit of change, rebellion and progression. The symbol of Set the Adversary shall take the earthen form of the Devil, the solar creative (and destructive) force of change and self-deification.

One- The Fallen Seraph Lucifer, the angelick essence of the Black Flame, the very source of our wisdom, being and becoming. Two - The Seraph of Flame, the Djinn Iblis of Fire, Daemon of the Blackened Flame, serpent – beast - dragon – wolf - goat.
In the Sethian Witchcraft Current the sorcerer becomes as SET him/herself, thus in the circle the first of Witchblood unto the path.
I shall transcend and ascend above all things, myself may only strengthen in this light In this hour I illuminate, I burn with the glory of Luciferian Light – Within!
I call forth the Shadow of which I am and have always been, The darkness which I nourish in between the light
My Will gives birth to the kingdom of Incubi and Succubi, the nourish their desires in the blood of the moon, Lilitu Az Drakul

The Ritual of the Adversary is a dual rite which explores, encircles and announces command over the entire approximation of self. While the rite is called for as one being conducted at both Noon and Midnight, the sorcerer may choose to conduct both the Noon (Light) and Midnight (Darkness) points at both hours, as an further focused point of ensorcelled energy may be raised.
It is essential that the magician looses all perception of anything outside of the circle, that being enflamed and submerged in gnosis, the circle is the circumference of the sorcerers' world.

The Ritual of the Adversary, in conjunction with the Lord's Prayer Averse (used in certain Luciferian Covens to summon the Devil-Cain) provides a powerful foundation for self-deification in the Witches Sabbat Gnosis.

critical_analysis.relevance: This text is highly relevant to contemporary Luciferian and Left Hand Path practices, particularly those focused on self-deification and the internal assimilation of adversarial forces rather than external worship. It adeptly integrates traditional demonic/adversarial archetypes (e.g., Iblis, Set, Lucifer) with modern self-empowerment magic, reflecting a syncretic approach common in modern occultism. The dualistic structure of Noon and Midnight rituals offers a comprehensive framework for integrating both solar (conscious, outward manifestation) and lunar (subconscious, inward transformation) aspects of the self into the adversarial current, promoting a holistic personal evolution. It stands as a clear example of modern Grimoire-style workings within the LHP.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of practitioners of Luciferianism, Sethianism, and other Left Hand Path occultists. It would also appeal to Chaos Magicians exploring archetypal currents and individuals interested in rituals of self-deification and adversarial gnosis. Familiarity with occult concepts, magical terminology, and a willingness to engage with challenging, antinomian symbolism are prerequisites for engaging with this material effectively.
